description: Buy the Thule Chariot Sleek online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chariot Sleek
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Sleek online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chariot Sleek
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chariot Sleek online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Why did we pick the Thule Sleek over other strollers ? 
1) Safety features : Frame is very sturdy, secured harness system and brakes are easy to activate. 
2) Comfort : It has adjustable recline positions, padded seating, storage space on the bottom and very smooth. Can be a little tight for two children but still very comfortable. Wide strollers for two children are a no for us because too bulky. Prefer this style instead. 
3) Maneuverability : Smooth and easy to steer.
4) Durability : Ive only had it for a couple of weeks but going based on the frame and wheels etc. it looks like it will do just fine. This is our 4th stroller we have some type of experience with strollers. 
5) Convenience : Compatible with our car seat, it easily folds, has canopy sun protection and has easy access to storage compartment.   
6) Style and Design : We love the Sleek design and thats one of the key features why we chose this stroller. Frame alone instantly loved it and knew it would be a comfortable. The wheels which we were most picky about chose Sleek because we are not big fans of small wheels. This is a step down from a running stroller which creates comfort. The bigger the wheel the more comfort the stroller from our experience. For us its a Medium size wheel which is great. And its designed two put more than one child having multiple options on how you want to seat your child or children. 
Conclusion : We love this stroller due to design, capability, comfort and brand. Thule makes products that last long and get your moneys worth. Its a Premium Sleek Luxury Stroller. We recommend this stroller and best one so far out of all the strollers we have bought.
review.name: Premium Sleek Luxury Stroller

review.reviewBody: I got this product for our new baby coming. We haven't got to fully experience the product yet but so far it seems very well built and easy to use. Only thing is you don't need to buy a rain cover for the unit as it comes with one. We bought one thinking it didn't come with one, now we have an extra one which is a waste. Only knock is they mention it comes with a rain cover.
review.name: So Far So Good!

review.reviewBody: I bought this on a black Friday deal and gifted it to the new parents. Easy to put together and easy to switch out basinet and seat. Only problem will be keeping the cat out of it!
review.name: A great gift for our impending grand-daugther

review.reviewBody: We have nothing but good things to say about the Sleek. It makes our long walks even more enjoyable with the family. It is light and smooth!  Love it.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Perfect for all our needs, me and my partner are stoked with this. Make like so much easier.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: Great quality product - we love everything about the Thule sleek. There is nothing flimsy about the stroller. Me and my husband are both tall and appreciate the height of the stroller. The solid rubber wheels are also great! We bought the rider board for our toddler , now baby and toddler are sorted! Definitely a game changer especially at airports and shops where you need your hands free. Thule gave us great online support - the purchase online was straightforward and easy.
review.name: Value for your money

review.reviewBody: We bought this 3+ years ago for our first child and it's been amazing! We used it with our infant carrier for the first few months, but we were able to switch to the stroller seat in lay flat made at about 4-5 months. We've taken this stroller on more walks than I can count, including light off-roading and snow, never had a problem pushing. Still looks almost new (aside from sunscreen marks and a little sun fading). It's also a nice looking stroller, similar look and feel to UppaBaby and Mockingbird, but with the history and construction of Thule -- which is what sold me.
review.name: Great full size stroller, great for light off-road

review.reviewBody:
An incredibly smooth ride for my kids and easy to push. Even my tall (6'4") husband is happy pushing it!

After my second child was born I knew I needed a different stroller to accommodate both children in various phases of growth (children 22 months apart). I previously had the Thule Urban Glide 2 which was great when I only had one child but I knew I didn't want the side-by-side double stroller. The Sleek is narrow enough to make it through the vast majority of doors. In America it fits through basically all doors due to ADA requirements, only when traveling to Europe in very narrow old building entryways did I struggle with the Sleek, but fair to say you would struggle with any stroller in those circumstances. I really love the versatility of the Sleek. It's great with two under two with the bassinet and main seat set up. As the kids get older, I've transitioned out of the bassinet and into the sibling seat and added the rider board. Its a bit cumbersome for everyday use with both seats and the rider board but i love the flexibility of it for my older child so she can be in the seat or on the rider board when we go for walks. And when my older child is a bit older still and walks mostly, I plan to transition to just the main seat and rider board. I love knowing that if I have a 3rd child, the Sleek can potentially continue to work for us with two seats and a rider board. 

The main downside of the Sleek is that unless you are only using the main seat, it's a bit cumbersome to take apart for getting in and out of the car with the second seat and/or bassinet. It cannot be collapsed with the extra sibling attachment. It can only be collapsed with the main seat. So you have to take it all apart and stow it. To be fair, I don't think this is necessarily any easier with similar models from other brands, but definitely something cumbersome for everyday use compared with the side-by-side types of strollers. 

One feature I miss compared with the Glide is the hand brake. Especially when I have the stroller loaded up with both kids and diaper bag it can be a bit heavy and scary in steep hills. The hand strap gives me a little more peace of mind, but it would be great to have a hand brake, especially for the price of the stroller. 

Overall the quality and appearance of the stroller are next to none. It is quality construction, sturdy enough for every day use, and luxury enough to feel comfortable. The seating and visor setup for the seats and the bassinet have all been very comfortable for my children and they regularly sleep long stretches (1-2 hours) in the stroller when we're out traveling. I do wish that the sibling and main seat were interchangeable as I find it a bit annoying that the heavier child has to sit higher up and I would have liked the versatility to chose which child goes where with the seats. With the bassinet this is not a problem, as it can go in the higher or lower position. I've seen other brands have more reclining options for the seats and the Sleek only has 3 options, upright, 45 deg, or laying flat - this is not an issue at all in every day use, 3 options for reclining is plenty. Overall it's very comfortable for the children. Even the seat belt straps are well padded for comfort.

TL;DR: Pros - quality construction, smooth ride, versatile as children grow. Cons - no hand brake, lots of pieces and cumbersome to collapse with all the accessories
review.name: Versatility and quality for all the kids!

review.reviewBody: Wow, you guys and gals are speedy, I received my shipment sooner than expected. Made for a great surprise and happy - happy customer.
review.name: Amazingly fast!!!

review.reviewBody: As expected, extremely well designed, easy to use, highly functional and pleasing to the eye.
review.name: Style & Function

name: Chariot Sleek

review.reviewBody: These are old-school glue on grips.  They are not lock ons.  They're cheap at around $11 and work better than anything I have tried for hand comfort.  I use spray paint and safety wire to anchor them in place.  When you first put them on they are a little too spongy but after a few months, they get a little firmer and are perfect.  I was not able to use lock-on grips because they were too hard on my hands.  I have been riding these for 20 years and swear by them.
review.name: Best Grips Out there

review.reviewBody: Best chamois for hot summer rides hands down. 7mesh thinks of the details by stitching the seams on the outside of the bib so they are not felt while riding!
review.name: Comfortable and breathable

review.reviewBody: Don't let the photo sway you from these shorts....they offer great ventilation UNDER YOUR BAGGIES. I've read that some choose to wear these as a stand alone bib short and would not recommend (unless you want to show off your junk). I've got severe eczema and need to keep my skin cool and dry as possible which it quite difficult. These foundation bibs have such great ventilation they keep everything cool and almost completely dry underneath baggy shorts (totally pair these with 7Mesh shorts such as the Farside). Chamois provides plenty of comfort on long rides and the mesh material has good stretch to them. I'm short and stalky and purchased these in a size large and they fit great (However I did purchase some of the MK3 bibs in a large as well and they fit a lot slimmer/tighter due to the different material...couldn't get them over my calves). Highly recommended!
review.name: Great ventilation under your baggies

name: Foundation Liner Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Spendy and better than the foam block pillows, but after a season of heavy use it has compressed quite a bit so stopped using it.
It’s heavy, I guess, but I used it for river trips so weight wasn’t a concern.
review.name: Decent and durable, with moderate use

review.reviewBody: I have neck issues so I'm very particular about my pillow and my sleep.  I feel like I've ordered and tried every camp pillow on earth.  The Hest pillow is BY FAR the best camp pillow that I have ever used.  It might be better than my home pillow.  This is the best piece of gear I have bought in years.  Highly Recommended!
review.name: Tried the rest, Hest is the Best!

review.reviewBody: This is the best pillow on earth!  Hands down my favorite piece of camping kit.  After using just about every pillow on the market I finally found the Hest Pillow.  It basically lives in my car so that I always have it with me.  Camping, couch surfing, music festival, AirBnB....I will always get a good nights sleep.  Highly recomended!
review.name: Best Pillow!

name: Camp Pillow

description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Traxion 7in Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Traxion 7in Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Traxion 7in Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
One of the reasons I chose these shorts was it stated in the website description that it had “ soft lining inside the waistband for comfort”  I have had two pairs of Mountain hardware shorts for approximately 15 years and they were awesome, they both had a chamois type material around the waistband on the inside and over the crotch area. This feature was excellent in hot weather when rolling commando. 
These shorts have no “soft lining” on the inside as stated, it is the same material as the outside. Additionally, the picture on the website depicts the drawstring on the outside where it is on the inside of these shorts. I guess if you don’t mind a knot or bow pressing against your abdomen, you would love these. And lastly, as one other reviewer noted, the size 34 is closer to a 33. 
It is very challenging to find a quality hiking shorts these days. Everything is from Chinese manufactures with thin material, poor cut, etc.. I came to Mountain hardware to find a quality product and I am very disappointed that it didn’t work out. I will say the fabric material was very nice and sewing quality looked good. 
I called Customer Service, but of course it is a outsourced call-center in another country with no option to get me to a real mountain hardware employee. It’s a shame what happens to these companies like Mountain Hardware, O’Neills and others. They initially specialize to people in their sport, but then sell out to becoming a mass market cheap clothing product line.
review.name: To bad..

name: Traxion 7in Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: I really like the material and the build of the shorts.  That said, I find myself somehow in between sizes.  I do tend to struggle with Patagonia bottoms as sometimes I'm a medium and sometimes a large (typical jeans 33-34 depending on brand).  In these shorts a medium is too fitted to be comfortable and the length is well above the knee.  The large is just above the knee and loose fitting.  However, the waist on the large is very loose and won't stay up unless I tie them very tight. review.reviewBody:
I wanted to like these shoes, but the BOA was annoying so I had to return.
I was attracted to this shoe for the wide toe box and an actual grippy sole for not sliding around on granite during my hike- a- bike moments. When I actually tried them on I was pleasantly surprised by the medium flex footbed. It has more flex than the Five Ten Kestrel, but slightly less than the Ride Concepts Tallac Clip.
Now the big detractor. The BOA did not have enough slack to get your fingers in and properly tighten the laces easily. I think if that BOA strap was sitting a little further down the foot, it would actually tighten and hold your foot where it is needed and make the laces less critical to use.
Note: The whole shoe runs wide.
review.name: The BOA needs work

name: Rime WP Mountain Bike Shoe

description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa X 1.5L Hip Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Allpa X 1.5L Hip Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa X 1.5L Hip Pack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I love this hip pack so much that purchased a 2nd for my twin sister.

We absolutely love it for hiking & traveling. Plenty of room for storing sunglasses, cards, passport, chapstick, and other items.

Very happy with this purchase!
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: I like Cotopaxi goods. I have 42 L backpack, 2. 0 L hip pack (travel by plane) and 1,5 L hip pack (daily use). I use two hip packs for different trips.
review.name: Triple C: comfortable, compact, colourful

review.reviewBody:
The Cotopaxi Allpa X 1. 5L Hip Pack is a standout accessory for those seeking style, functionality, and comfort in a compact design.

Comfort
This hip pack is incredibly comfortable to wear, thanks to its lightweight construction and adjustable strap. Whether worn around the waist or as a crossbody, it sits securely without feeling bulky or cumbersome, making it perfect for extended use.

Organization
One of the best features of the Allpa X 1. 5 is its multiple compartments. The thoughtfully designed pockets allow you to easily organize your essentials—wallet, phone, keys, and even small gadgets. This level of organization eliminates the usual rummaging around in your bag and adds a layer of convenience.

Design
The aesthetics of the Allpa X 1. 5 are top-notch. With Cotopaxi’s signature vibrant colors and sleek design, this hip pack isn’t just practical—it’s also a statement piece. Whether you’re on a hike, running errands, or exploring a city, it pairs functionality with style effortlessly.

Conclusion
Overall, the Allpa X 1. 5L Hip Pack delivers on comfort, organization, and style. It’s an excellent choice for those looking for a versatile, everyday carry solution that doesn’t compromise on design or practicality.
review.name: Allpa X 1. 5

review.reviewBody: It was one of the best purchases you can make, the size is comfortable. The colors are very pretty and the manufacturing texture is 10/10
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: I was looking for something to keep my valuables on me while traveling by plane, train, bus, etc. and something I could use to walk around the city while leaving my main luggage back at the hotel. This sling bag is perfect for that purpose and I love the style of the all-black color.
review.name: Perfect Sling Bag for the Plane, Train, and Exploration

review.reviewBody: Perfect size if you want a little more room for things that you just can't leave the house without. Love the different pockets and organizational features. Will definitely recommend!
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I love the storage and many pockets. I’m a plus size person and I wish the straps could be extended further. I’d planned to wear it as a crossbody but it’s too tight for that.
review.name: Hip pack

review.reviewBody: It is impressive what you can fit in this hip pack. I fit ALL of the things in here: my cell phone, sat phone, external battery, charging cable, baggie of tp, wet wipes, sanitizer, wallet, gum, snacks, passport, chapstick, headphones, travel size deodorant, tissue, meds, and my sun glasses when I wasn't wearing them. This hip bag is a like a mary poppins bag.
review.name: Keep your things close

review.reviewBody: I got 4 for a trip to Italy. All 4 of us loved it. I bought this to have passports and wallet infront of me- felt safe from pickpockets. Very convenient and stylish. The size is perfect. I had my phone, a hand sanitizer and a small tissue pack in there too.
review.name: Buy it!

review.reviewBody: Beautiful colors and great quality, super happy with my pack!
review.name: Super cute pack

name: Allpa X 1.5L Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: The poles are sturdy when fully extended but the dynalock did not keep them in place when in the retracted position. Was pretty disappointed and surprised - high risk of catching the backs of your legs and/or tearing gear when strapped to the back of a pack or when carrying them in the retracted position.
review.name: Poles slide out and catch knees

review.reviewBody: Took these on the sea wall trail (meat cove to pleasant bay, Cape Breton) over three and a half days of rugged terrain. They saved my bacon and will be coming on every hike from now on!
review.name: Durable!

review.reviewBody: I like these poles. But when I went to change the baskets to use them in the snow, they were very difficult to get on and off. So hard to put on that I apparently didn’t get one of the baskets on securely and lost a basket snowshoeing. Unfortunately MSR does not appear to sell replacement baskets.
review.name: Good poles but baskets are hard to change

review.reviewBody: took them to mount whitney to use for the first time and they bent. We were doing the mountaineering route and terrain was intense, but still I was surprised at how poorly they did
review.name: took them to mount whitney

review.reviewBody: Happy with the poles. Thought I could just use ski poles, but I love how these fold down and can slide into a backpack if I want. Also nice to be able to adjust them if someone else wants to borrow them. They are relatively light weight.

review.reviewBody: I'm very happy with my new poles and was a little surprised for how lite they are.

review.name: super sturdy and light adjustable

review.reviewBody: When the poles are completely retracted, the bottom section slides in and out of the upper section. Quite irritating when transporting- the ends are catching on everything.
review.name: Nice Poles Lower Portion Loose When Retracted

review.reviewBody: These are great poles for snowshoeing and I even use them touring
review.name: Quality pines

review.reviewBody: Definitely a cool hat, but a snug fit. Even when I'm  on the last hole of the snapback it leaves a red band line across my forehead. FWIW, I do have a fairly large noggin; somewhere between 7 1/2 and 5/8 for fitted caps. Hope it stretches out a bit.

review.reviewBody: Just an overall quality hat. Most trucker hats that I've worn are typically uncomfortable on my ears, but not this one. Really comfortable and great to take on hikes. So far when I've worn it on multiple hikes and runs and the brim and front of the hat hasn't shown worn or sweat stains, which has been great.
review.name: Quality Hat

review.reviewBody: Love this hat, and now has become my "go-to!" I bought the orange hat, as it matches all my wonderful Tennessee gear. Love it, fit's great and most importantly...the bill on it has the perfect bend to it. Not flat, but not bent to much...just right!
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: If you're as picky about hats as I am you know how hard it is to find a well fitting hat. The sweatband construction makes it super comfy and the custom internal taping adds a nice touch of detail.
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket so far - only a couple days of skiing with it, but so far so good. It's a little on the longer side and a straight cut, so be aware if you have curves (like me). I did have to size down to a small (have the bibs in a medium) as I was swimming in the medium jacket. It's roomy and has great freedom of movement. It does have a a second zipper, so if you feel the length / hip room is a bit snug when bending over, you can totally unzip it a little. Love all the pockets it has too - and have been getting tons of compliments on it!
review.name: Great All-Around Jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Only used once. No issues, happy with the look and fit. Did not get to test it in inclement weather yet. Price is steep, but hopefully it proves its worth
review.name: Loved the color pairing

review.reviewBody:
Hi purchased to go with Northface goretex bibs.  Liked the multi colors which brighten up the black bibs.  Lots of pockets.  Zippers were sticky, but I guess thats needed for waterproofing. .. and jacket is stiff likely due to goretex material.   This would be great to keep me dry but requires layering for warmth and M felt a bit big.
At this price point $$$ I wanted more boxes checked  5'7 small would have been too snug in hip area so returned.
review.name: Great Features but..

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for changing temperatures, and so far it's amazing for the crazy Irish weather.. can't wait to test it out in Greenland in a few weeks and really put it to the rest on the windproofing and extreme weather by layering! Great roomy fit without looking too bulky!!
review.name: Diverse and effective

name: Summit Verbier GTX Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Optics are great. Frame is light and fits well. The breakaway snap hinges are a terrible design idea. I doubt they sell these again next year. hasVariant.description: Buy the Lake MXZ304 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These are great mountain biking boots.  Very warm.  A must have when you live in New England area and also Chicagoland IL.  I have 2 pairs.  They do run small so size up.  I wear shoe size 10 and got these boots in size 45.
review.name: Very warm

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a size 14 shoe, for example in a Merrill Moab 2 Ventillator, where I have plenty of room in the toe box.  I also wear a size 48/US 13.75 in a Specialized Recon 2.0, which fit me very well.  The Lake MXZ304 in size 48/US 14  is too small for me with a medium weight SmartWool sock.  My toes don't hit the front, but the toe box is very tight.  It's hard to tell how close my toe is to the front because the toe of the MXZ304 is very stiff, but I can't wiggle my toes and the overall width of the boot feels tight.  On the other hand, the Lake MXZ304 in size 50/US 15 feels just about right.  My foot slides into the boot with just a little bit of effort and the toe box is roomy enough to wiggle my toes.  The overall width of the boot does not feel loose or tight--just right.  The boot is much lighter than I thought it would be from looking at it.  The uppers are very soft, almost pillow like, and because the upper is so soft, the ankle bends very easily (as in there is no resistance at all), so it seems like you could hike for hours in the boot if you wanted to.   I think the sole feels a little narrow, so the boot might not offer great stability when hiking (examine the image of the sole),  I am not a fan of the Boa system, so I would prefer laces.  My Specialized shoes have two sets of plastic grommets (like eyelets on a laced shoe), and when I tighten the dial it only tightens the wire closest to the dial, so I have to pull on the wire at the front of the shoe to even out the tension.   The Lake MXZ304 has one Boa dial for 4 sets of plastic grommets, and I find I have to pull on the wire like a shoe lace to try and tighten the wire near the toe.  What would you rather pull on: a thin wire or a soft shoe lace?  The Boa system is so bad, I can't believe any product manufacturer uses it.  The least Boa could do is include some kind of lace puller with their system.  I tried to simulate what it would be like pedaling with cleats by trying to pull the boot off my heel, and there wasn't too much movement.  I also tried really cinching down the Boa system to eliminate any slop, but I got some pain around my ankle despite how pillowy soft the uppers are, so there is a limit to how tight I can make the boot fit.  I have some Lake MX146's in size 48 and size 50 coming in the mail, and I will compare the two models and decide on which shoe I will keep.   The size 50 will definitely work for me, so at least I have one option for winter cycling.
review.name: Size 48 and size 50

name: MXZ304 Mountain Bike Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: My main complaint with this bag is that I would have hoped the main body of the bag be bigger or be expandable or somehow have more space. I like putting things in the top outer pocket for easy access, so unfortunately this portion (of the overall bag) ends up looking bulkier and shoved with many items. I really enjoy the stretchy elastic at the front and have used it for my bicycle helmet, lunch container or other gear.

review.itemreviewed: Prosecco Tech Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my new "go to" for a base layer in temperatures up to 55 degrees.  It has excellent wicking properties so that I never feel wet and/or cold on those Florida winter rides while working up a sweat.  The design does what it intended so that it can be tucked into your bibs without being excessively hot since the fabric that is tucked in is much thinner.  One big plus is that the top is flexible so that when you're standing it doesn't pull at the chest as opposed to a standard cycling jersey.  Because of this, I  can wear it on my runs where it performs just as well.  As a matter of fact I just ordered another one so I can alternate between the 2 without having to do laundry daily.
review.name: Excellent Base Layer

review.itemreviewed: Prosecco Tech Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've used it with a Castelli thermal outer top in weather in the 40s-50s and I've stayed very comfortable.  The back tucks into bibs so it stays in place.  Fits well.  As usual with Castelli, I size up to XXL.
review.name: Excellent light weight base layer

name: Prosecco Tech Long-Sleeve Base Layer - Men's

review.reviewBody: I cannot live without this hat!  I’ve been wearing them daily for over 8 years.  I have two.  One is for dirty/rugged activities like backpacking, sailing and gardening. The other is for clean/cute activities like walking, sightseeing, or going to the farmer’s market. The foldability is great for traveling, honking, or even just to stick it in a pocket when you go inside, like at a restaurant.  The chin strap is great, and the glasses holder works perfectly. Tip:  switch your sunglasses and reading glasses from nose to brim when you’re outside and need to look at your phone or a map and compass..
review.name: Can’t live without it!

review.reviewBody: I love this hat.  It has good coverage from the sun on the sides and back.
review.name: Great Hat

review.reviewBody: So light and comfortable, I forget I’m wearing a hat!  Love it so much!  Looks great on everyone.  Friends see mine and order one often.  Have bought extra for gifts.  I can’t rave enough!  Hope Sunday Afternoon never stops making this hat!
review.name: My Go-to hat!

review.reviewBody: Gift for world traveling daughter.  Hat is heading to Spain next.
review.name: Traveling hat

review.reviewBody: This hat is the BEST outdoor adventure hat I’ve ever found.  So light and airy, I wear it and forget it’s on bc it’s so comfortable!  I’ve bought several for myself and more for friends who love mine.  Great great hat!!!
review.name: Greatest hat ever!

review.reviewBody: Love this hat the folding brim works great it's easy to pack it in your pack or even stick it in a pocket when not needed hope they put that in their other hats too
review.name: Great hat

review.reviewBody: Love it. Perfect sun protection for pickleball. I now own four of these. The length of the brim is just right, not too long like the adventure hat. I wish they have more colour.
review.name: Ultra adventure hat

review.reviewBody: I'm not particularly fond of the folding feature or the big seam needed to accommodate it, but this hat is really good protection and very light. It's not my go-to hat yet, but I'm warming up to it. It looks a little silly, but you can't argue with performance.
review.name: Very light and good protection

review.reviewBody: I wanted a hat to wear on long sunny runs that also protects the side of my face.  This hat offers great sun protection and comfortably stays in place, however the material and vents are not as breathable as I would like for running.
review.name: mostly great for long sunny runs

review.reviewBody: My ULTRA ADVENTURE HAT is perfect for pickleball or a day at the beach.  It packs easily and is much more attractive than my old model
review.name: Perfect for pickle

name: Ultra Adventure Hat

review.reviewBody: These have been my go-to gloves for years. I love that they come with a waterproof liner so they can be versatile in all weather. They’re lightweight, but warm. Highly recommend!
review.name: Love these!!

review.reviewBody: I love these gloves. They have a light to medium thickness to them, which keeps me warm for short walks and commutes to/from the car during cold temps. I like that they don't have cuffs, so they are easier to put on. The pull tabs are good for clipping them or slipping them in a finger to hold securely when I have to take one off for some reason. Sizing is spot on. I also like that I can clip them together so I don't lose one.
review.name: Very good thin gloves

review.reviewBody: Bought these gloves for a Patagonia hiking adventure. Seemed like the ideal solution. However, on a day that started with light rain a degree or two above freezing and evolved to a heavy snow a degree or two below freezing, their ability to keep my hands warm and dry utterly failed. In a mitigating factor, everyone’s rain gear and gloves failed. Only locals with multiple gloves and sets of rain gear stayed warm and dry.
review.name: Not for Patagonia

review.reviewBody: Love these gloves. My first pair are on their last legs so I am getting a new pair. I must admit I have rarely used the shells but good to have. No complaints although I would prefer very slightly longer 'fingers'.
review.name: Replacing 1st pair

review.reviewBody: These are really versatile. The clever design means you can pull out the outer cover from its own little pocket on the back of the glove. Alternatively, if It is really cold, you could put a heat pack in that pocket. The gloves themselves are mid weight and fit try t I size. A good purchase.
review.name: Versatile Gloves

review.reviewBody: I purchased these gloves for wet weather hiking here in the Pacific Northwest. From day one I had a problem with the shell wetting out quickly. I had purchased a pair for my son at the same time and he has had the same experience. During my last backpacking trip in extremely wet conditions, I had to actually wring the shells out they were so saturated with water - I only wore them because they provided some wind protection. I also find putting on the liner gloves difficult, especially if my hands are cold/damp, and the shell offers no protection. I am extremely disappointed by the performance of these gloves, and wished I had stuck with my $10 insulated gardening gloves.
review.name: Save your money

review.reviewBody: Poor quality. I ordered these in July and have only used a handful of times but the finger already has a hole in it and the other finger is developing a hole.
review.name: Poor quality

review.reviewBody: I purchased these over the winter. I went with what the size chart recommended, and the size was perfect. I love that they have the shell that zips into the gloves. I found the shell easy to get on, and easy to put back in the zippered compartment. The sensor fingertip doesn't work for me 100% of the time, my assumption is that the gloves don't always keep my fingertips warm enough for the touch to work through the glove. I wouldn't rely on these in freezing temperatures, but they do a good job in cooler temps.
review.name: Nice gloves, love the pocket

review.reviewBody: Excellent fit. I wear these biking, ski touring, ice climbing, and for day-to-day activities around town. Haven't had them soak through the waterproof layer, so I am quite happy with them.
review.name: Love these gloves

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great for cool rainy days when you need your hands dry but not the bulk of traditional waterproof gloves. I wear them on rainy/muddy walks with my toddler, so I can play with him and not worry about cold, wet hands. They're not fleece lined like my nearly identical OR gloves, so that was a bummer, but the waterproof cover helps keep warmth in too. I'm not finding the "sensor" aspect functional-I can't use my phone wearing the gloves (without the covers, of course). I love that the covers fit into a little zippered compartment on each glove, but when they're wet, I wish they could clip to each other so I could put them elsewhere and not lose one.
review.name: Dry dexterity but not much sensor function

name: Versaliner Sensor Glove - Women's

review.reviewBody: It’s a bit small for me maybe they will stretch out some
review.name: Nice gloves

review.reviewBody: I bought these gloves in XL, which is my normal size.  These gloves were the tightest XL ski gloves I’ve ever worn.  Also the fingers were short.  The tag says XL but they fit more like a large or even a medium.  Most reviews of these gloves are very positive; I’m wondering if I received some kind of anomaly??  These gloves seem well made otherwise.
review.name: Unexpectedly small

review.reviewBody: Keept my hands dry and warm no matter the conditions from freezing rains, to sub zero temps. Removal liner is a nice feature
review.name: Warm and dry

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was in a near 10-hour ice storm while summiting and descending Cayambe. Put these on as my mid-layer gloves became drenched from all the wet. These gloves rehabbed my hands back to warm and kept them warm from summit back to base!
review.name: Survived an ice storm on Cayambe in these

review.reviewBody: Can't truly rate these gloves because I had to return them. They fit a lot tighter than I was expecting after using the measurement guide.
review.name: Tighter than expected

review.reviewBody: It's my second pair. Work great in temps around 0C.
review.name: Great all round glove

review.reviewBody: Gloves were wind and waterproof during 48 hours of digging trench in rain snow hail & mud + week of use in the field. Only reason I could not use these gloves at the end of the 48 hour period was because it was so caked in mud that I could not grab the shovel and pickaxe. After being dried out it was good to go. It has exceeded my expectation and will be my go-to gloves for any kind of cold wet weather.
review.name: Above and beyond

review.reviewBody: Use a variety of OR gear. This pair is to replace a pair that after many years, fingertips are splitting. Won't get the field test until next winter. Anticipate 5 star when AT skiing. Thank you. Always happy with quality, knowledge, service.
review.name: To soon

review.reviewBody: All-around winter glove for use in Alaska - primarily winter fatbiking. Have also used for snowblowing, other outdoor activities. Have used them in single-digit weather, but not below zero (yet). I've found them to be very warm, depending on level of activity. For more passive activities like riding a 4-wheeler, I didn't find them to be impressively warm, but for active use - biking for example, they're great. The inner gloves are useful, though the touchscreen capability seems hit or miss which can be frustrating. The gloves are very warm without the liner. I didn't read closely enough that the palms and backs are leather which doesn't thrill me, but thus far (several bike trips) it hasn't been a negative.
review.name: Solid choice

review.reviewBody: I just love those glove. The fact that there is a insert pair of grove makes all the difference to me. Easy to clean, warm and long enough to cover your jacket sleeve.
review.name: Third pair

name: HighCamp Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Backcountry has taken a month to deliver...bar tape. When I called CS they said, the economy shipping "takes a little longer." I'll say. The worst part is I still have not received my order and no one seems to know where it is.
review.name: Never received my order

review.reviewBody:
When it comes to cycling, comfort and control are paramount. One crucial aspect that often goes unnoticed but significantly affects the overall riding experience is handlebar tape. Enter the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape, a revolutionary product designed to provide cyclists with an exceptional grip and enhanced performance. In this comprehensive review, we will explore the features, benefits, and performance of the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape, ultimately highlighting why it stands out from its competitors.

Unmatched Grip:
At the core of the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape lies its remarkable grip. Crafted from high-quality rubber, this tape ensures a firm hold on the handlebars, even during wet conditions or intense rides. Its unique gecko-patterned texture enhances traction, preventing any slip-ups that might compromise control and safety. Whether you're tackling rough terrains or racing on a rainy day, the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape provides an unbeatable grip that instills confidence in every cyclist.

Unrivaled Comfort:
Comfort is another area where the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape excels. The rubber material not only offers an outstanding grip but also absorbs road vibrations, reducing fatigue and discomfort during long rides. The tape's cushioning properties provide a pleasant tactile experience, allowing riders to enjoy their journey without worrying about hand fatigue or soreness. Additionally, the soft texture of the tape feels luxurious and supportive, adding an extra layer of comfort to your hands.

Durability and Longevity:
One of the standout features of the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape is its exceptional durability. Thanks to the high-quality rubber construction, this tape is built to withstand the demands of intense cycling sessions and adverse weather conditions. It is resistant to tearing, stretching, and fading, ensuring that your handlebars remain in top-notch condition even after prolonged use. This remarkable longevity makes the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape a wise investment for cyclists who value durability and reliability.

Easy Installation and Maintenance:
Installing the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape is a hassle-free process that can be completed in no time. The tape comes with a secure adhesive backing that ensures a tight and secure fit on the handlebars. Additionally, the tape is flexible, allowing for easy wrapping and positioning. Cleaning the tape is equally effortless, as it can be wiped clean with a damp cloth, making maintenance a breeze for cyclists who prefer to keep their gear in pristine condition.

Style and Aesthetics:
In addition to its exceptional performance, the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape boasts an attractive design that enhances the overall appearance of any bicycle. With a wide array of color options to choose from, cyclists can easily match the tape to their bike's frame, creating a visually appealing and cohesive look. Whether you prefer a vibrant and eye-catching tape or a more subdued and classic style, the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape offers options for every taste.

Conclusion:
After thoroughly examining the features and performance of the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape, it is clear that it exceeds expectations in terms of grip, comfort, durability, ease of installation, and aesthetics. This bar tape stands out as a top-notch choice for cyclists of all levels, from casual riders to professional athletes. With its unparalleled grip and cushioning, the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape provides the confidence and control necessary for a truly exceptional cycling experience. Don't compromise on comfort and performance – choose the Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape and elevate your rides to new heights.
review.name: An Unmatched Grip for Superior Cycling

review.reviewBody:
Hello!

First reviewer yay!

I have used Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape since 2017. 

I have used many other brands such as Lizard Skins, Supacaz, and generic cork bar tape but none in my experience or opinion are as good as Arundel Rubber Gecko Bar Tape.

I have this bar tape on my road and gravel bikes. I ride year round in all weather conditions and not once have I had a loss of grip or control since using this product. It is tacky without being so sticky to leave your hands covered with it especially when sweating profusely. It is comfortable to grip strongly or with little pressure.

I can count on this product when I am climbing or descending it is reliable and comfortable. Bar tape is a small part of the bikes overall performance but it is a main contact point and as such should always reassure your riding, leave you feeling confident and excited to ride that little bit more when you already fatigued. 

I am not sponsored by Arundel but wouldn't say no. I am just a sincere fan and wanted to share my thoughts and reasoning behind my product choices. 

Thank you!
review.name: Great grip comes great rides

review.reviewBody: Bought this for the price point and was disappointed in the lack of cushioning. For grip, it's awesome, but on a long road ride it doesn't measure up to some good, soft gel tape.
review.name: Better suited for off road

review.reviewBody:
I love the grip water no problem they handle very well. 

Love to have them in other color *
review.name: Great tape

name: Rubber Gecko Bar Tape

review.reviewBody: All you need to do as a hunter is use the mystery ranch line of products weathers big game or just hiking around m mystery ranch has what you need the best packs on the market
review.name: Missed your ranch products

review.reviewBody:
Do yourself a favor and buy the set *first* and start experimenting with different pack configurations. I wish 20 years ago someone would have told me that you are supposed to pack smaller bags within your larger bag so that your stuff is not only organized logically, but doesn't explode into a congealed disaster of clothing and gear after moving the bag once.

The top portion is indeed translucent, but definitely not that super tacktile type plastic that will rip if you look at it wrong. The dimples take care of any snag points; great design.

Sometimes it takes seeing someone else do it correctly for you to facepalm and then totally change your methods. Try packing things by use case. For example, the largest cube holds my outdoor/woods/wilderness clothing very well. Get the full set so you have a true understanding of what it can be used for, and THEN order more individual bags as needed. Don't do what I have done sometimes and guess first, complain, then do it right the second time lol.
review.name: Do you ever travel?

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight. Hopefully doesn't correlate to durability. Time will tell. Fits all my first aid stuff for the backcountry.
review.name: Lightweight

review.reviewBody: Utilitarian, well designed and ideal size for packing/storage.
review.name: Excellent quality…

review.reviewBody: I have bought several different brands of interior storage bags over the years but nothing compares to the cubes. I can roll up clothing nice and tight inside the cubes and their ability to lay flat and stack inside my main travel bag is so crucial.
review.name: Truly packs better

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag a few weeks for some of my vlogging gear. It works perfectly. I have a gimble in it a small portable fog machine and a foldable air tube light. I absolutely love it. As I buy more blogging gear for my you tube channel I will buy another bag. This is my second mystery ranch bag. I also have the large Mission Control bag for my go pro and its accessories.
review.name: Perfect for my Vlogging gear

review.reviewBody: This makes it so quick and easy to find what I’m looking for in my Metcalf 100.  No more pulling everything out to get my socks, t shirts and other items.  I would highly recommend these if you like organization and efficiency.
review.name: Organize any bags content

review.reviewBody: The bag so nice I bought it twice. The easy to see through top is perfect for traveling. Love this bag
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody: Really great way to organize your gear in the bag and keep the digging or yard sale moments to a minimum. Great for keeping your kill kit together, first aid, filtration etc.
review.name: Pack Organized

hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Baltoro Pro 85L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Carried around 35-38 lbs (consumables, dog and camera gear and packed-outs.... ) for 7 days in Sierra high country. Discomfort was very negligible over time. No pressure points, no rubbing, no hotspots.Very stable and felt well balanced scrambling up and down granite face and while bolder hopping. Couldn't be happier :-)
review.name: Extremely efficient heavy load hauler!

review.reviewBody:
Night this as an emergency replacement for the Arctic circle trail when I was in Copenhagen. 
I am 203cm and this is the only pack I have every felt comfortable walking 100 miles with 
Thank you for a terrific product
review.name: Great fit for 203cm

review.reviewBody: Deciding between this and the bird competition. I really, really, really want a nice color like red, or blue, orange - anything but black would do. Black gear is so common and depressing.
review.name: Don't want a black backpack.
comment: Thanks for your feedback.  Our top of the line, heavy hauler gets the job done when most packs would crumple under the pressure.  We will make sure your feedback regarding color options makes it to the product developers.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a trip with my wife involving a 10-day, 124-mile food carry (High Sierra Trail to Mt. Whitney and back). I wanted the extra-large volume so I could carry more of our combined cargo. It easily fit 2 BV500 bear canisters, our 3-person tent, 10-degree sleeping bag and pad, electronics and battery banks, among other things. Total mass at the start of our trip was 60 lbs (equaling 30% of my body weight). The structure of the pack was excellent for handling this heavy load. I loved the water bottle pouch on the lower right side of the pack... much easier to access than any other pack I have. There is also a deep vertical pocket on the left side of the pack. My only minor suggestion for improvement would be to add another deep pocket on the right side of the pack but maybe this isn't possible because of the existing water bottle pocket. The shoulder straps also have plenty of attachment points for adding after-market pockets/pouches (add added one to each shoulder strap... one for carrying a small coffee bottle and the other for my InReach satellite device.
review.name: Hauls a serious load very well!

review.reviewBody: Good fitting pack easily adjustable but it really needs external side pockets to be a great pack.
review.name: Good fitting pack but….

review.reviewBody: I've had the original Baltoro (which is a 70 liter) for many years and have brought it on a lot of summer backpacking trips. I have been a loyal proponent of that pack. It fits my body well, distributes weight efficiently and is a great all-around pack. For 3 season, extended day trips I decided to get the 85. I had expectations that it would perform as well as my original Baltoro and have not been disappointed. The new design upgrades are great and the extra space allows me to pack more gear without compromising efficiency and ease of use. I used it this past October on a four day trip on the AZT and it performed great. Super adjustable to dial in my specific body specs. Excellent pack!
review.name: Lives up to the Baltoro name

review.reviewBody: Difficulty fitting. Sags under load. No parts can adapt the fitment on this new version. Hit belt seam digs into skin.
review.name: I want to love this pack. It’s impossible!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just used this on a backpacking trip in the Uintas, and it worked great. A lot of my gear is older and bulkier so finding a pack that can carry a lot of weight and still be comfortable is big priority for me, and I felt like this pack did a great job of it. The hip belts are extremely comfortable, and I love the shoulder straps which can adjust perfectly to take the extra weight off. I also love the top flap and all of it's pockets which provide a ton of space to carry things which I need immediate access to. 

#giftedproduct
review.name: Love it!

name: Baltoro Pro 85L Backpack

review.reviewBody: These boots have very hard soles but hold up well to cold temperatures, snow, and ice. They do require leg gators to keep snow out of the top but are built tough. The laces have a latch strap to keep the bottoms snug and without a doubt worth the price.
review.name: Good boots for outdoor ice and snow extremes

review.reviewBody: I've worn these boots for awhile so I could give a fair and honest opinion. These boots take awhile to break in but wow they are great on rough terrain. I used these boots recently to clear buildings and I was wearing ballistic gear. These boots made my feet secure and I felt like i could walk over anything. The biggest plus to these boots is there is no gortex. I live in a high desert area so these boots haven't been wet yet. I can't say anything about them being waterproof. To be honest that's of little concern for me. I wear wool socks with these boots and they do feel warm but the wool socks do a good job of keeping moisture off my feet. The sole is very nice. I was clearing a house with slippery hard wood floors and the sole gripped just fine. The ankle support is pretty awesome as well. The one complaint I have and almost every boot company is guilty of the following. The insoles suck. For the life of me, I wish boot companies would either not put anything in the boot or offer better insoles. I wear a size 14 and size 48 is perfect for me.
review.name: Kick in doors and rescue babies

review.reviewBody: Awesome great for climbing trees cant feel my gaffs
review.name: Bomb proof boot

review.reviewBody:
This is a great all around boot- great support, rugged construction 
I’m a 9.5 some what slender foot and find the 43 size 10 to fit perfect with a thick sock.
Good choice for heavy backpacking, summer mountaineering or tree and forestry work
review.name: Excellent boot

name: Karakorum Mountaineering Boots

review.reviewBody: I've had the jacket out once on a warmish, snowy and blowy backcountry ski day. It performed well. The fit is good - I'm 5'11", 170 lbs and I bought a large -- and the large hood and lengthy arms with velco straps kept blowing snow out. The jacket stayed dry and I did not get too warm while going uphill. The Dawn Patrol seems like a good stormy-conditions counterpart to my OR Ferrosi softshell which is great for spring backcountry outings but not as weather proof as the Black Diamond.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: Breathable and keeps the wind out. Very useful in all but wet conditions. It seems very durable, after 6 years mine is not showing real signs of wear.
review.name: Great jacket for spring ski touring and hiking

review.reviewBody:
I know this was designed as a ski shell, but this was ideal for a fairly mild day hiking on Franconia Ridge, NH.

It was great for temperature control, breathing well on various uphills but blocking 35-40mph winds well enough to not miss my hard shell. It was really nice to have pack compatible pockets and a stretchy fabric to warm my BD mitts against my chest. It was great to have confidence in the fabric's durability with the many downed trees and various obstacles along the trail, rather than worrying about ripping a shell...

 Thanks for a great jacket!
review.name: Multi use - great for backpacking!

review.reviewBody: Breathes well to regulate temperature on uphill efforts, good protection on the downhill. Internal pockets keep skins warm and sticky. Very happy with purchase. Very functional piece of kit.
review.name: Great for high tempo efforts

review.reviewBody: Unlike many other ski shells, this one fits true to size. I am 6’2” and 190#. I ordered XL. Full shell fabric that is stretchy. Thin with no insulation.
review.name: Fits true to size

review.reviewBody: Great as an outer coat or layer on cold days. Fits true to size and great pockets for Backcountry Skiing - which are hard to find on most coats. Design of materials used helps the coat vent heat on the uphill.
review.name: M's Dawn Patrol Shell

review.reviewBody: Super happy with this shell. Fits well and works well. Would buy again
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: The flex is impressive and very breathable! Fit is on the athletic side yet comfortable.
review.name: Flexy and breathable

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'1", 180lbs and this was a snug fit. Most Large jackets fit fine, this one the sleeve length was perfect, but the chest and shoulders were snug. IDK if I'll try an XL as the sleeves and other aspects might change for the worst.
review.name: Snug fit

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to jacket for winter hikes in the white mountains of NH, but it’s also great for ice or alpine climbing. I’ve bought a second one for when the first eventually wears out incase it ever gets discontinued! It’s made of a really durable, stretchy, and comfortable material similar to OR’s cirque pants. The inside drop-pockets are nice for items you don’t want to freeze like soft-flasks, electronics, or snacks! Does great in moderate wind or mildly wet/snowy weather. It’s not the lightest jacket, but it’s so durable I never worry about abusing it going through narrow trails or blowdowns. Get it!
review.name: Great jacket!

name: Dawn Patrol Softshell Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter loves these boots! They are a versatile shoe for midwest winters and can stand up to being worn by an active four year old. They are so cute with slim pants and leggings with dresses. We always get lots of compliments on them! Can you please make these for adults?!
review.name: Love these boots! Please make for adults!

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody:
these shoes are so hard to put on! I bought them a size too big for my son and I had to force them on. Once they were on, there was a lot of room for his foot so it's really just an issue with the laces being too tight and there is no way to loosen them.
No kid's shoe should be this hard to put on
review.name: way too hard to put on

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my 5 year old grandson. He loves them! He can put them on himself and says they are warm and comfortable. He is wearing them everywhere daily!!
review.name: I bought these for my

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: Love these for my son! Great for wet slushy weather.
review.name: Favorite boots

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: We bought these for the first time at end of summer with hopes that they would take us through fall to early winter. Well we are in February and these are still going strong and they are my 2 (almost 3) year olds daily pick for shoes. We play in the mud, puddles, snow and slush and his feet are always warm and dry when we come in. They are easy to clean and holding up so well. I love how flexible the sole is and that his toes have room to spread unlike most shoes. I will be back to purchase another pair!
review.name: Will buy again and again

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: shoes are super cute and love the color, BUT the smaller sizes (we got size toddler 9) have a small top opening so it's really really hard to get those toddler feet in. And the shoes are not waterproof. They are water resistant in light rain, but anything more or sustained play in the snow will penetrate the shoe membrane.
review.name: hard to get on and not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody:
Bought these for my son, he wore them on a bike ride on a damp day, no puddle jumping and no walking through standing water...
His socks around his toe were wet.
Keen has come through and approved our warranty claim so could be a fluke...
They are a tidy shoe and on the occasions where he wore them on a dry day, he was very warm!
review.name: They look good but NOT waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: My 2 year old outgrew her tennis shoes and rain boots half way through the rainy season. Enter: the Howser. Her feet are dry and toasty even after a puddle splashing walk. They clean easily after muddy hikes. She can’t rip them off in the car. These shoes are like magic.
review.name: Is it a tennis shoe? A hiking boot? A rain boot? A magic unicorn shoe that keeps feet toasty? Yes!

review.itemreviewed: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’
review.reviewBody: Difficult on and off. Three year old said they hurt and didn’t want to put on a second time.
review.name: Hard to get on

name: Howser II WP Chukka Boot – Little Kids’

review.reviewBody: I bought two of these boats in 2018 when my daughter was 6 years old. They have been extensively used both for playing, lake paddling and multi-day sea trips. Thw tow line is a very helpful feature and it works well to tow kids behind a single sea kayak even longer distances. They are stable, durable and robust. Since they have a V-shaped hull they track relativelt straight, and much better then other kids boats we have tried. They lack foot rest, which would be a nice upgrade. My kids have been able to use the boats up until approx 11 years of age, or 150-155 cm length.
review.name: Great boat for kids!

review.reviewBody: This kayak is exactly what I was hoping it would be for my kiddo.  It's light-weight and a piece of cake to lift and load onto the car, and my son has no problem carrying it to the water by himself.  It's nice and narrow for his kid arms to paddle but stable enough that he hasn't capsized.  The only thing I'd add is foot pegs, but as a beginner, he doesn't know what he's missing.
review.name: Perfect fit for my nine year old

review.reviewBody: I was very disappointed that the heron jr. doesn’t come with adjustable foot pegs or any for that matter. The seat is also pretty poor. Priced too close to adult size kayaks with more features and abilities is my main gripe, though. Come on old town. It’s for kids. 200 would be plenty for this bobber.
review.name: Too expensive

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my granddaughters fourth birthday, she took to it immediately
review.name: Great for child

review.reviewBody: Great product to use before heading out away on trips. Super simple and accurate.
review.name: JetGauge

review.reviewBody: It is like in an image. Have not checked yet. After test will share opinion.
review.name: Gauge

review.reviewBody: Great value for the price! Now I know exactly how much fuel I have so I never run out. Love this!
review.name: Amount of Knowledge

review.reviewBody: Got this before a 5 day hike with a friend. Because it was her first ever overnighter over a single night, I wanted to reassure her big packing fears, one of which was running out fuel. Sadly the gauge would only show percentages for 450g canisters, while we would be hiking with 100g ones. I tried holding down the power button to switch what canister size the gauge was reading for, and instead it decided to become a simple scale and has refused to change settings again since.
review.name: Does not allow me to change settings
comment: Thank you for your review. Your Jetgauge may have been initially set to 450g canister. In this case, pressing and holding the power button for 1 second will change device to scale only...this is correct. If you press and hold the power button AGAIN (for one second), you should see the canister size change to 100g size and unit of measure changes back to "%". in other words...you use the press/hold method to cycle through FOUR settings...100g, 230g, 450g, and SCALE. Try it and if you are still not getting the unit all the way back to 100g w/% , please call Customer Service toll-free @ 1-800-572-8822 M-F between 8am and 4:30pm and we will work with you on a replacement unit.

review.reviewBody: Not accurate,  gets a different reading on the same bottle.  Used a bottle for 5 days cooking all my meals with it and the gauge still shows 100%
review.name: Not accurate
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We would  like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your experience with your JetGauge. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST and we would be happy to look into your concern.

review.reviewBody: Our expectations for the JetGauge were very different than what we received, I should have read the reviews more thoroughly. Please know the Jet Gauge does not measure the pressure of fuel left in the can, the Jet Gauge is a weight-based best guess electronic device. Our needs will also vary between the 100g and 250g fuel canisters when traveling, camping, or hiking so please ensure you select the correct fuel cell size before you weigh the fullness of remaining fuel. Once you have the correct size selected you will need to thread the mount to the can, lift by the electronic gauge, and see where the percentage finishes if you have a steady hand.
review.name: Weight-based, no a pressure measurement
comment:
Thank you for taking the time out to leave your review. We would like the opportunity to speak with you further on your findings. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday. 

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

review.reviewBody: Extremely useful in gaging how much fuel is left for cooking and when to change out fuel cans. Always happy with Jetboil products.
review.name: Very Useful

review.reviewBody: Saved us from taking an almost empty canister on a camping trip because we could tell there was only 1% fuel left.
review.name: Very useful

review.reviewBody: I get a different result for the same canister every time. Concerns me that this is just a gimmick and not really a reliable tool.
review.name: Different measurement every time
comment: Thank you for reaching out. I am sorry that you are having trouble with your JetGauge. We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concern. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday.

review.reviewBody: This solved the growing collection of half filled gas we collected due to anxieties about running out while backpacking and always grabbing a new one!
review.name: Quick & Correct

review.reviewBody: Sidi Megas have been the answer to managing my hammer toe.  Thought I would try Shimano R-Phyre which were disappointing when it came to extra width. I'm taking advantage of good sale offered by Competitive Cyclist,  It will be interesting to see how well push dials will work as opposed by the lever/strap of Genius 7's. With the hook strap on Ergos it should allow me to loosen for toe area. I will probably need to use Specialized insoles which have worked well in Gen 7's. Don't get me wrong as the Gen 7's have been impressive. But the Ergo 5's on sale were only $30 more than a new pair of Gen 7's at MSRP.  The Ergo 5's at MSRP are $130 more and I could not pass up a good deal. I trust the Ergo 5's will not be a disappointment.
review.name: Moving from Genius 7 Mega to Ergo 5 Mega
comment: Your preview was interesting, but a review would be more helpful to those of us wanting to know more about actual experience with wearing the shoe and real-world application, rather than speculation.

review.reviewBody:
You know what you want from your cycling shoes: light weight, cushioning, support, and a comfortable fit. Of course, the most important part of any shoe is your experience over the hundreds of miles you'll take them on. Like running shoes and workout shoes, cycling shoes can bring you a lot of joy or a lot of pain. Choosing the correct fit is key for comfort. If you don't, you may end up with blisters and cramps in your arches -- ouch. 

I originally purchased the 43.5 and they were an inch to big. Competitive Cyclist  was quick to turn around and send me 42.5. If you have flat feet like myself, you don't have to suffer from ill-fitting cycling shoes anymore. These are the ones! It was like Cinderellla putting on her glass slipper on for a perfect fit!

I think this is one of the best cycling shoes for flat feet. The Mega is ergonomically designed to provide relief for those with flat feet or heel and foot pain from any cause. If you have flat feet and are looking for a comfortable pair of cycling slippers these are the one!
review.name: No need to buy anything else....

review.reviewBody:
So, a few months ago, a cycling buddy said to me, "Sidis suck. You should try something else." 

I have been wearing Sidis for decades, but then was thinking, maybe they are a little too whipped out, maybe too big by a 1/2 size; my mind started working on me. I was using my mtb shoes on my road bike anyway, so I bought some road pedals and I started doing research on who makes the wide style shoes. I tried on: 

Bont (shipped from England!)
Shimano S-Phyre
Specialized S-Works
New Sidis in 43.5 and 44 to compare. 

The Bonts were instantly the wrong thing, like trying to jam my foot into a wooden box. 

I actually bought and wore the Shimanos for a while, convincing myself that they were ok. They just became too narrow, in odd places that I couldn't figure out. I needed more research. 

I put my mountain pedals back on my road bike and dug deeper. With my Shimanos, the Specialized, and the Sidis, I tried them on over days, with different socks, in different moods; I tried to make it a longer process, and my wife was just scratching her head again and again. 

In the end the Specs had a better (wider) toe box than the Shimanos and I almost went with them. But what I realized is that both the Specs and the Shimanos have heel cups that extend forward on the outside of the shoe, that pushed on the outside metatarsal just as it hits the ankle. That bone sticks out a little. The Sidis cup surrounds the heel, and doesn't continue forward, so that bone doesn't get pushed. And there is more room in the toe; I definitely don't have my big toe touching anything. I have a photo there of the Spec shoe. 

It was an interesting study, and maybe needed, but I will stick with my Sidis because they actually really don't suck. I will keep buying!
review.name: Consistently great for years

name: Ergo 5 Mega Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: As always, try to find a place to try on for best fit, but for me this hit all the marks. Fit, comfort, breath ability and adjustability. Doesn’t hurt that it’s sleek too. I’ve tried about 4-5 different helmets before I found this one and I stopped the search immediately. This is the one for me!
review.name: Best helmet for my dome

review.reviewBody: I've been riding with this helmet for about a year now and it has held up wonderfully! Super comfy, lightweight, and looks awesome!
review.name: Great helmet!

review.reviewBody: I wore the helmet for two weeks…the best MTB helmet I’ve had. Cancer won’t let me wear it again until next spring, but I can’t wait!
review.name: Viva la Poc!

review.reviewBody: Thankfully no true testing and f the impact protection thus far.
review.name: Comfortable light weight.

review.reviewBody: This may be the most baller MTB helmet out there. Great looks, perfect fit (which can be dialed easily via the rear adjustment knob), and an adjustable and REMOVABLE visor. I have been wanting a hemet that I can remove the visor for when I ride the road. I know most people have separate road and MTB helmnets, but in my opinion that  isn't nessecary because i don't know how much aero benefit there is in a helmet for someone that is not a road racer time trialer. Unfortunately the tiny clip that snaps in on the side of the visor cracked off the first time I removed it.
review.name: Visor removal is delicate

review.reviewBody: Upon checking, you can see some the defects on the visor. It is noticeable, the cut outs is still not done (cosmetic defects and poor workmanship) and  something that you would not expect from highly reputable helmet brand. I hope POC will continue to improve their quality control.
review.name: Poor Quality Control

review.reviewBody:
I've gone through quite a few helmets over the years. Some I've liked, few have I loved.  This is easily my most favorite helmet I think I've ever had. Its super comfortable, flows a crazy amount of air and I really love the technology built into the helmet.  

I tend not to scrimp on helmets because I don't want to learn how to tie my shoes again. It was super hard when I was four. I can't imagine how hard it would be in my fourtys.  This helmet really makes me feel like I got a lot of value for my money.
review.name: Freaking Love It!

review.reviewBody:
I was out mountain biking with this helmet and got bucked off my bike really badly. The crash ended with one of the largest head impacts I've ever experienced. I heard a snap in my ears and started freaking out because I thought I had broken something. Turned out the sound was just the MIPS system inside the helmet snapping under the rotational impact so my head didn't. In the end I came a way with little more than the wind knocked out of me. I would credit this helmet with the fact I do not have a serious concussion. 

Side note: I talked to POC and they are sending me a replacement part for free to put into my helmet.

This helmet definitely gave me sticker shock at first but I think in the end it was worth it.

you only get one head so I would recommend protecting it
review.name: Saved my head

review.reviewBody: I have the helmet but waiting for single track season in the high Rockies. I do want to comment on the fit of the helmet. I have wore Specailized, Kask, Giro, and Lazer; this POC by far hugs my skull the best out of all those brands. The Kask coming in second. We all have different head shapes and mine is more oval than round. The POC Kortal is light weight and feels great on my head the few times I've put it on and given it the shake test. Will update my review once mtb season comes to the Rockies in CO.
review.name: Great Fit

name: Kortal Race Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: The same sizes fit different depending on the fabric. For example one is GREAT in a Medium but BIG in a Medium. I spent $24.99 for what was 5 day shipping and now the refund price is $7.99 to ship it back. Just keep that in mind.
review.name: I LOVE this rashguard, BUT

review.reviewBody: Love this top and have it in two other colors, however the stretch varies per fabric and the Palomar top in Aries is very restrictive...still keeping because the fit is fierce and maybe it'll just stretch out over time.
review.name: Very cute but fabric is tight

review.reviewBody: The bottoms that go with this top are amazing and have a zipper (which probably isn?t even necessary). However, this too runs VERY small (think like wetsuit and not rashguard). Also, the top DEFINITELY should have a zipper at the neck. The opening is VERY small and DOES NOT stretch. It was very uncomfortable to get on and actually left marks on my face after pulling it over. The sleeves are short and the overall fit did not match that of the bottoms. I love them so much, but have to return because they are hard to match and this top just did not work out.
review.name: Very Small and Hard to Put On

review.reviewBody: Fantastic gym shoe. Incredibly soft and sensitive and quite capable on small feet if sized correctly. Heel rubber extends very far up and the tension is great for a slipper style shoe. Really stays on your foot during heel hooks. I wear a USM 8 street shoe and got these in USM 8 as well. My feet are wide and kind of tall. Break in period was pretty rough at first because these shoes are kinda narrow but they give a bit with how soft they are. That being said most of the shoe is wrapped in rubber so it won't stretch much at all. Continuing on the softness; these shoes are not aggressively downturned but they allow you flex your foot to grab onto stuff when things get steep.
review.name: Fantastic gym slipper

review.reviewBody: Love the way these look and seem like they would be a comfy all around soft shoe. They are pretty pointy but I am used to more downturned toe shoes and prefer it downturned. These are pretty much flat and if you like that, these would be great. I'm a sneaker size 9.5 and order these in 8.5. The 8.5 are a perfect performance fit for me, but I like really tight fitting shoes. If you want more of a relaxed fit, go with your regular street shoe size or half size down.
review.name: Great looking chill shoe

name: Roam Soft Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: These Teva's are the most comfortable candles I have ever owned. The only problem is the strap broke after only wearing them for two months and only wore them a couple of times a week. That is disappointing after I paid a lot of money for them.
review.name: Not happy

review.reviewBody: Just outside the warranty period....i am so sad and they were expensive! I have 10 different pairs and this is the only style that has failed.
review.name: My favorite Tevas EVER broke in 16 months :(

review.reviewBody: These shoes are great. They are super cute and comfortable. I have worn them for upwards of 8-9 hours per day and my feet did not hurt at the end of the day. I appreciate all of the points of adjustability, helps fit the shoe perfectly to my foot. Also very versatile, I can dress them up or down! Definitely recommend!
review.name: Super cute and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I was so excited for these and have bought tevas in the past! A strap ripped out within a week (I maybe wore them 3 times) They were SUPER comfy but so sad that they fell apart so fast!
review.name: Broke Within a Week

review.reviewBody: I wear these everyday. I am a busy florist and am always on my feet. Sooo comfy!!!
review.name: Looooooove!!!

review.reviewBody: I received my sandals and have worn them many times. I could walk all day in these Teva sandals. I tell everyone about them because they are so awesome.
review.name: I love these Sandles

review.reviewBody: I was excited to find a pair of "dress Tevas" that didn't have a leather insole (which I find incredibly uncomfortable in addition to how quickly it becomes filthy.) I was excited (but not surprised) to find that these were super comfy even with the big platform, and the Honey Brown color goes with everything. Unfortunately, today the side strap pulled out with no provocation -- I didn't roll my ankle or catch my heel. It looks like the strap itself is still intact so I might try gluing it back in, but having bought over a dozen pairs of Tevas in the last decade or so, I've come to expect them to be a bit more durable.
review.name: great idea, middling execution

review.reviewBody: I have bought teva sandals in the past which have lasted me years. I had these for less than 2 months and was walking on a city sidewalk when the ankle strap became detached from the sole and I was stuck with a broken shoe the rest of the day which gave me terrible blisters. I am extremely disappointed and frustrated that this happened, especially at this price point and from Teva I expected better quality. I would not recommend Tevas.
review.name: broke in less than 2 months of normal use

review.reviewBody: I bought these sandals for a recent vacation and it was the best purchase I made. So many compliments. All my friends told me to send the link! Also, they are amazingly comfortable. I trecked around everywhere and felt like I was walking on clouds. Would highly recommend the Universal Cares style.
review.name: Obsessed with these sandals

review.reviewBody: I've wear them all summer long. Do I need to say something else?
review.name: I use them every day!

name: Universal Ceres Sandal - Women's
