comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: This made for a get night sleep in the middle of no where we did not have a lot of pack space.
review.name: Compact smaller than a water bottle

review.reviewBody: Been using this all over for two years now and it’s incredible, still holding up great. The cover is nice because it makes it a lot more comfortable and can be washed. Even used it as a second daily pillow while living in a hostel in New Zealand.
review.name: Perfect camping pillow

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, great size and packs down fairly yell.
review.name: Very comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This pillow takes up a little more space and is a little heaver than my old pillow but comfort is king. I sleep much better with a good pillow.
review.name: Just right

review.reviewBody: As pillow goes this is excellent for camping. My only complaint with it is a little thin. I would prefer something a little thicker, even if it was not as wide. In the future will be using it with a shirt or something placed under it to raise it up higher. Easy to fill it up and outside lining comes off completely for washing. I would recommend a nice camping pillow.
review.name: Comfortable but a little thin.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for military field exercises. For many years, I brought along a small travel pillow which takes up alot of room in a rucksack. This pillow is large, soft outer washable shell, and compacts down to about 5/6in. This was a great addition to my gear.
review.name: Field Camping Pillow

review.reviewBody:
Awesome pillow! Light, easy to inflate, super cozy!
This is just what I was looking for.
review.name: Awesome pillow! Light, easy to

review.reviewBody: Great inflatable pillow.  It works as advertised... Personally I like something a little bit more memory foam but if you looking for something for backpacking this is one of the best I've had.
review.name: It's great for what it is

review.reviewBody:
My first sleep with the pillow was at our son&#x27;s house, in his hammock. Best hammock sleep, ever!
Got home and order two: one for the house hammock and one for the trail!

review.reviewBody:
So, this jacket has a cool style, great fit in the body but one major problem: The sleeve length.
I don’t have monkey arms but the sleeves were very short. Normally I wear a medium and I bought this in a medium. It fit me perfect everywhere with room for layering except the sleeve length. By comparison, I have a volcom jacket in medium and the sleeves are about 4” longer on that jacket. I really wanted to keep this, but functionally it will not work for me. With my arms extended straight out in front of me, it falls well short of my wrists. 
If you have t-Rex arms you’ll be fine.
review.name: Short arm length

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Compression wings on outside too stiff and made packing hard, obstructing opening
review.name: Compression wings on outside too

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great design - rugged and also streamlined. Love the extra compartment on the backside and the compression straps so you can "make it fit!" The green color is great and helps it stand out from the crowd on the luggage carousel. Another thoughtful and well-made design from Osprey!
review.name: Great design - rugged and

review.reviewBody: After 20+ years with a prior model, the plastic piece that held it upright when standing broke. Since Osprey no longer makes it that way (much improved stand incorporated in a single piece across the bottom of the bag which also connects the wheels), they didn’t have a replacement part, so they gave me a brand new bag! It has all the pockets I loved about my other suitcase, plus it cinches down with these padded wings that protect the contents. The handle is the only thing I don’t like. I’ve had surgery on my thumb, and it hurts to grip the handle as tight as needed to raise it up. Overall, a solid product, though, and pretty amazing that the warrantee is lifetime!
review.name: Osprey’s warrantee is fabulous

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Generally like the duffel a lot. Only complaint: the handle rises to the fully extended position only about 1/2 the time.
review.name: Generally like the duffel a

review.reviewBody:
I really like the Sojourn 45L. Materials are great, and I personally like that this is NOT a spinner. I've had spinners and have never pulled a carry on using all four wheels; I typically tilt and pull and this bag works perfect for that. Zippers are heavy enough and pull tabs are fantastic. The fact that they are backed by a lifetime guarantee makes it even better. If a zipper were to fail here, you have two layers of straps to hold your items and bag cover in place. So much better than standard luggage design where its one point of failure and your stuff is everywhere. Pockets and zippers are well thought out and the pockets are on the inside which I like. External pockets adds to the possibility of more zipper snags and issues- not something to need to worry about with this design. It has nice sized wheels that roll easy. The wheels themselves are easily changeable if they were to ever wear out by using a hex wrench.

The size is good for a few days to a week for how I pack and layout overall works great. While this is bag is technically slightly bigger than the domestic size of what many airlines would like, I've not had any problems getting this through TSA or issues on flights, whether on smaller planes where luggage has to lay on its back (yes, it fits wheels in), or on flights with big enough overhead to be able to put it onto its side. The bag stands on its own easily, even with a backpack sitting on top of it, provided you have enough volume of stuff in the bag to give it some form. 

The only thing I didn't like about this bag is the handle. Its made to squeeze two pieces of the handle together to release the handle lock. There is a space in between the two pieces that you can pinch a finger in it if you are not paying attention. It got me and I got a blood blister from it, so you do have to be mindful when you use it and a good pinch will certainly help you remember. Secondarily, it's not the most ergonomically comfortable handle if you have to pull it long distances. The handle alone is not a a big enough deal that you should look at something else, but something to be aware of. I took one star off for the handle design. It makes the bag not quite perfect, but very good overall. I expect this bag will last many, many years and the fact that it's backed by Osprey and their guarantee adds a layer of comfort. I have no hesitation recommending this to you as a solid option for your consideration.
review.name: Solid performer with one small drawback

name: Sojourn Shuttle 45L Bag

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Anorak - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a better jacket solution for days with the family on the slopes since my previous jacket was too fitted to constantly bend over to help my 4 year old with his snowboarding bindings. I ski, but my kids all snowboard. It's super generously sized. I could fit a thick hoodie under this with room to spare, but I appreciate the sizing because I sometimes wear a hydration vest under my jacket (so I have water for the kiddos). The material is a lot softer than my other jackets and I was a little worried about how it would wear, but so far it's looking great after one full day out. The hood is nicely sized and fits over my helmet and I even managed to take it off WITH my helmet on because I forgot I had it on when I went for a potty break. The front velcro pocket is massive and holds all the snacks, it was a bit deep to go searching for my phone, but I'm going to try the side zipper pockets next time. I'm a women's 6/8 and I went with a medium and it's baggy and perfect. 

The negative (ish): It has a few loose threads and it does wrinkle up a lot (mostly from holding my son on the ski lift) and time will tell how the softer material holds up. I wish I could find the matching snow pants but they're out of size medium because it would be a lot easier to use pants with a Anorak over my bib (especially with a hydration pack on top, but that's on me). That's all i have for negative LOL.
review.name: The perfect snack jacket

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Anorak - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love this jacket- it’s surprisingly warm when worn with a heavy fleece underneath. I like the versatility of being able to adjust to weather by adding/removing layers. Side/pit zippers are very useful. Have not had the chance to test its waterproofness yet. But love the kangaroo pouch with divider to keep some items secure. Only upgrades I wish this jacket had would be a cinch at the bottom, and on the front of the hood, as well as a clip inside the pouch for keys/phone.  A prior review would have saved me a lot of buying/returning, as it runs very large. I am 5’4 and 135 pounds so ordered a medium and large. Ended up with a small, which is still pretty roomy for a heavy layer under. Bought an XS too, for spring skiing when no sweat shirt required. Hood is large enough to flip over helmet for a windy chair (but can’t secure it). Great jacket for the close out price especially.
review.name: Great jacket

name: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Anorak - Women's

review.reviewBody: Ordered the Redington Escape Wading Pants from Backcountry.com and upon 1st use, the waders leaked at the stocking foot-ankle connection. Backcountry service was just wonderful and expedited an new replacement set covering all shipping costs. Great company! My 2nd set of Redington Escape Wading Pants leaked at the exact same area on their 2nd use. Redington quality has certainly eroded as has their customer service. I highly recommend you avoid these wading pants in favor of Simms or Patagonia. I will be purchasing Simms and sending these wading pants back to Redington for them to whatever they please. Complete waste of money.
review.name: Redington Quality Issues

review.reviewBody: Great fit, very comfortable. Quality made. I would buy again. Med reg fits perfect. My wading boots are sz 10. 30 inch inseam, my waist is 33-34 inch.
review.name: Love them

description: Buy the SRAM AXS eTap Battery online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: AXS eTap Battery
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM AXS eTap Battery online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I hadn't carried a spare AXS battery on me until my front derailleur died on me during a training ride. Wasn't the end of things, but definitely was a wake up call to carry a spare. 

Just after pulling the trigger and getting this as a spare, another racer at BWR California was frantically trying to find an AXS battery in the parking lot for his rear derailleur which he inadvertently left at home. I lent him mine and saved his race...
review.name: Carry a spare AXS battery!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had these since the inception of etap. Yes the tabs are prone to breaking so be very careful installing.  They are more expensive than they should be but the alternative china imitations are not recommended. Thank you Sram. I alway carry a couple of spares as they are very lightweight.
review.name: Seam etap battery

review.reviewBody: I purchased a new bike with the SRAM AXS etap wireless shifting. I went back to the dealer to purchase an extra battery. They told me they couldn?t get it until Sept 2023.  I searched the internet and Backcountry had them. I ordered one and with hours I had a tracking number and a few days later I had the product. A few weeks later I decided to order another one and again it arrived very quickly.  It is so refreshing to find a company that provide excellent customer service. I will order from this company again.
review.name: Great Company

review.reviewBody: The struggle is REAL people! Both my battery tabs broke off so cause I'm cheap I use electrical tape to help secure them.  I should send a photo of this to Shimano haha!  Can't imagine SRAM is proud of the look of electrical tape on thousand dollar derailleurs, but apparently they don't mind as they offer no relief for defective batteries past two years.  Not even an exchange and a redesign.  Come on SRAM you can do better.
review.name: Battery Tab Breakage Issue
comment: Same problem for me.  Obviously a design defect.

name: AXS eTap Battery

review.reviewBody: I purchased a couple of this specific buff. I mostly use for wearing over my mouth and nose when walking around my neighborhood. I purchased for this use, because of the pandemic. If you fold it over itself/double it up, it works well for a face covering for outdoor use. Now that it?s Fall and colder out, I?m getting more use out of it than previously. I wear one every day around my neck (which keeps my neck nice and warm), and I pull it up over my face when out and about.  It?s super soft and comfortable and washes up nicely.  It?s not as effective as a proper mask, as it is very thin even doubled up, but it?s fine for outside when you?re not right by other people anyway.
review.name: So comfortable and soft

description: Buy the Coleman Cascade 18 Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cascade 18 Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Cascade 18 Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My intended use for the stove sole purpose was to make coffee in a percolator while camping. With the provided great being so high off the burner, it would take forever to boil water. Had to weld up my own stainless steel grate so that the percolator would sit closer to the eye and it still takes 20 minutes to boil water.
review.name: Great stove to keep items warm, but not to cook.
comment:
Hello. Thank you for sharing your experience. We’re sorry to hear that the grate height didn’t meet your expectations for your percolator setup. The design aims to balance heat distribution and safety, but we understand your disappointment. We’ll share your feedback with our team for consideration in future designs. If you have further concerns or need assistance, please let us know via our "Contact Us" website at https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us.

Thank you,
Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
It works, does the job I need it to do for simple one pot cooking. However it does have some flaws. Coleman, in this modern day outdoor gears. You need clever simple design and engineering. 
1) Knob turning will always need finer adjustment rather than relying on cheap graphics. Every piece is important to the entirety, the Stover pressure regulator shouldn't be an afterthought. 
2) Needs better stability grates.
3) My biggest upset is not providing a hardcase for transportation and for stowing.
4) Needs a solid secure placement to hold down the store pressure regulator. (Hence hardcase)
review.name: Decent but always need finer crafting
comment:
Hello!

Thank you very much for your thoughtful feedback on our Cascade™ 18 1-Burner Camping Stove! We will definitely take it into consideration! We also apologize for the inconvenience!

Should you require any further assistance, please kindly reach out to us directly via our official "Contact Us" page.

Thank you!

Coleman Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: Stove went out and I was unable to cook the second batch of fish.
review.name: Help.
comment:
Hello Alex,
We're sorry to hear about your experience with our product. Your satisfaction is important to us, and we want to make things right. Please reach out to our customer support team at 1-800-835-3278, available Monday through Friday from 9am to 6pm EST. Alternatively, you can submit a detailed inquiry through our online contact form: https://www.coleman.com/support/contact-us or place a formal claim here: https://www.coleman.com/warranty-information.html We appreciate your feedback and look forward to resolving this issue for you.
Best regards,
Coleman Customer Care

review.reviewBody: used it twice and it's working great. It will be used a lot  next summer and I will be able to give a more comprehensive review
review.name: Coleman Cascade one burner stove

review.reviewBody: The only thing that would make it better is a case.
review.name: Great stove

review.reviewBody: Very sturdy & well made stove, only draw back is the grate & propane connection are loose, this item really needs a storage bag or box, like the butane stove.
review.name: Sturdy & well made

review.reviewBody: This stove is great it heats well, is compact, and is easy to use. I do wish the grate had a clip or something so it didn't slide out of the well when it's time for storage, but that is minor. We have it in a Plano box we use as a mess kit so once it is in there it's pretty secure. The only suggestion would be to put the knobs for the gas and the sparker on the same side. It's a little too wide with them on opposite sides to neatly store away. Otherwise I think this will be a great addition to our camp gear. We had no issues with the flame flickering in the light breezes we encountered. It seems that as long as you're not cooking in a head on wind it would do well. Cooled down quickly, and packed away neatly. Thank you Coleman for offering American made products that are well built.
review.name: Great for two person car camping

review.reviewBody: Great sized burner. Simmer control is fine but not precise. Wish it came with a case and a windscreen
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: Good packaging. Easy set up. Convenient. Works great! Only negative is that there is no click or clarity on when the fuel is actually off.
review.name: Great but not perfect!

review.reviewBody: I love this stove. Used it to warm up tamales, cook eggs and a steak and boil water for pasta.
review.name: Quick to heat & lightwieght

name: Cascade 18 Stove

review.reviewBody: Since 2020 and COVID, I have worked at a home office. My wife, rightfully, does not like us to wear outdoor shoes indoors. So I was looking for a pair of sandals I could wear in my home office and around the house. The joyful colorway of these badboys, combined with a neutral color sole, sold me. I have other Tevas to wear outdoors; these are staying indoors.
review.name: For Indoors!

review.reviewBody: This is my 3rd or 4th pair of Teva sandals! I typically wear the sandals for knocking around town, light hikes, at the beach, and sometimes canoeing. The sandals are quite durable as well as comfortable. I switched from Women's to Men's sandal models back around the late 1990s. The women's sandals do not accommodate my wide foot comfortably.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: This pattern designed original is "Awesome" TEVA Archival Revival Collection Issue #005 M Hurricane XLT2 Revive: I have worn my Teva original design sandals I've owned over the years till they practically fall apart on my feet in the settings where I love to wear them most! TEVA products are a go to for me!
review.name: What's Not 2 Love About Original?

review.reviewBody: I use these sandals on my feet because I don't like to walk on the city sidewalks barefooted.

review.reviewBody: Loved the colors and design on these and the mens 4/womens 6 fit was great but they had a very odd smell. Hoped that a few days out if the box would ease the odor but it didn't so I had to return them. I originally thought the smell might be b/c of the bright green on the sole but I ordered the blue swirl (also mens 4/womens 6) and it had the same odor. The sole on them also felt slick, not grippy like my other Tevas. I ordered black and the olive/black pattern and they are fine.

review.reviewBody: #30 is still ticking and use as my backup for road cycling for the app, Ride with GPS. This new #35 is a great addition fir my gravel/rail-trail cycling. So delighted to have these rugged external batter packs. Thx
review.name: Better than my original #30

review.reviewBody: My wife got me this for Father’s Day and it has absolutely been an awesome on the move way to charge my iPhone
review.name: Great little charger

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Venture 35 to replace my Venture 30 that(along with the Nomad 7 solar panel) has served me well on trips to the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro in 2016, and Everest Base Camp in 2018. I’m sure the Venture 35 will do the same.
review.name: Perfect charger for most needs

review.reviewBody: Not much to review about this powerbank. Flashlight is a nice feature. But charging? Yep, it charges devices. At least it used to. Used it for a couple of times, every time before using i'd notice the power in it reduced - i'm not a professional in power banks but it seems kind of weird for powerbank to discharge on it's own. Perhaps it's the reason why after a while of lying on a shelve it no longer charges. It's been lass than two years having it and now it's another piece of waste. I've specifically chose goalzero as it looked like a decent and reputable brand but my initial experience with this power bank is that some cheap generic power bank would've served me better.
review.name: Great when it works

review.reviewBody: I bought this to work with my Venture 30.  It's a great little power bank, but it needs one major improvement--the port plug.  It is advertised as being IP67, and it is, as long as the port plug is closed.  That's great if you just want this power bank to sit out in the rain.  If you want to connect an USB cable to charge the unit, or use it to charge your phone or action camera, it's not IP67.  The port plug needs a pass-through port to allow the end of the USB cable to be a watertight seal.  One reviewer said he removed the port plug; I may do the same because it's in the way when using the unit.  When the Venture 35 was in the development stage, the Product Engineer Team should have noticed this and addressed the issue.  I can't believe it would have added that much more to the cost of the unit.  The other downside is, there is no place to store the cable like there was on the Venture 30.
review.name: Great little unit

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the nomad 10+venture 35 . Seemed to charge up ok. stored it for 3 weeks
and checked it. Nothing in it. Charged it again, had 4 lights lit, wouldn't even light the flashlight. Put it back on charger and it won't charge
review.name: Bad product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Goal Zero Venture 35 Power Bank is a must have whether you keep it in your car to charge your phone, take it on camping trips to charge USB devices or keep it on hand for hurricanes which is what we will use it for. Now we don't have to take up a plug on our generator for keeping our phones charged. This great little bank can charge 3 devices at once! It only takes 3 hours to charge up and it retains its power for 3-6 months! Winner! I love that it is waterproof and has a built in 50 lumens flashlight. Small enough to keep in your backpack for hikes etc. I'm just totally impressed with this device and highly recommend it. A+
review.name: A Must to Have!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Venture 35 Power Bank has been an absolute game-changer for me during my outdoor adventures! Its robust and rugged design makes it perfect for rough terrains, and the impressive 35000mAh capacity ensures that my devices stay charged throughout the day. I love the versatility it offers with multiple USB ports and even a built-in flashlight, which has come in handy more times than I can count. Moreover, the fast-charging capability is a real time-saver, allowing me to quickly top up my devices on the go. Whether I'm hiking, camping, or traveling, the Venture 35 Power Bank has proven to be a reliable and essential companion that I can always count on to keep my gadgets powered up and ready for action!
review.name: It has become an essential item for my day hikes.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received my new Venture 35 battery pack about 30 days ago and I have really put it through the riggers.  I am currently using it to recharge the Pool Speaker as there is not a plug near the speaker location (keeping it away from the water).
The Venture 35 has been able to charge up the speaker very easily and has power left to recharge my iPhone 14.  The water resistant feature is very nice and allows this to be a very rugged battery charger.
review.name: Best Back Up Battery Pack on The Market!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really like this handy power bank, you can charge it 3 hours with the USB-C or 6 hours in the sun. It has enough storage to charge my phone about 5 times. It also has a flash light, battery indicator on and off. I like that it is waterproof. Great product!
review.name: Great battery bank!

name: Venture 35 Power Bank
